title: Does not work on cell connection iPhone 5s
text:
This app has iPhone 5S - specific error. When iPhone 5S is on cellular connection only (no wi-fi), app works only in relay mode. This means you can not access videos stored on camera's SD card. Apparently, in iPhone-5S version, app checks if you are on cell connection only, and switches app to work in relay mode only. I was able to prove it using this setup: 2 identical iPhone 5S, placed next to each other. Step 1: disable wifi in both phones, launch SmartCam on both phones (one by one) - and you will get relay mode only. Close apps on both phones. This step just confirms that app on either phone does not work. Step 2: Enable WiFi Hotspot on one phone, disable cell reception on the second phone, enable WiFi on the second phone and connect to the hotspot created by 1st phone. Launch SmartCam app and you will see that it works in full mode, w/o relay. 
Support is not helping, ther official story is that Relay mode is used only if there is no enough bandwidth. The experiment above shows that it is not true.
Bottom line: if you have iPhone 5S, DO NOT buy these camearas. You will not be able to use them as intended.

title: Camera is decent, app is terrible
text:
The good:
Camera isn't bad, setup was fairly painless and quality is pretty good. I'm happy with functionality and because it's one of the only cameras that has on camera storage where I don't have to pay for a cloud service or set up additional equipment I consider that a large plus and the primary reason why I chose smartcam in the first place. 

The bad:
The motion area setting doesn't work, period. I set the region high to avoid my cats tripping the motion center and they do anyway. Because of that, the motion alerting option is useless. For motion capture, my cameras will miss events completely sometimes which is concerning and only capture a certain period of time even if there is continuous motion. Because of that I have been forced to turn on continuous recording. 

The Ugly:
The app is disgusting...seriously I can't believe a tech company like Samsung has something this bad out. It's ugly, clunky, unresponsive at times, and completely in-user friendly. There needs to be controls to move forward and back while viewing videos instead of having to go back and forth. Need to add a way to see an initial image of each motion capture clip so I can see if I care about it. Is it a car driving by or someone walking up to my house? 

Summary:
As much as I hate the app, I do like and recommend the camera and have high hopes of future improvements or integration with SmartThings. The app is bad but it is useable and gets the job done in the end.

I have internet service with Xfinity (Comcast) and getting about 33-50 Mbps on iPhone 6+ measured via Speedtest app. The delay is about 2-3 seconds monitoring live even with LTE not Wifi.  I'm waiting for this app to be able to view multiple cameras instead of viewing one at a time.  If that happens then for sure I'll buy two or three more.  The two way audio on the camera helps a lot if you're monitoring kids or pets. I only gave 4 stars because of not having multiple cameras on the app. Other than that then this is a good app matched with good camera. I've tried Arlo from Netgear and that is nothing compared to this.  Tried and tested both Arlo and Smartcam HD Pro and that's when I realized how good, easy setup, and reliable the camera and app. To the developer of Smartcam app - thank you but please... add mulitple camera view option.  We do live viewing constantly and it would really help to be able to view multiple cameras at the same time and have the option to maximize the screen on one camera.

title: I was AMAZED, then disgusted, now better
text:
When I first got this camera and app combination, I raved about it to friends, even those who find Samsung to be a reprehensible company. Slowly, but surely, I have had to whittle my praise down to what barely qualifies as a two star review. The whole point of this camera is to see who's at the front door! But every time I get an alert, pull up the app, and connect to the camera, it takes almost an entire minute before I can see an image, by which point the deliverator or friend is long gone! Then it takes another minute to pull up the recorded video, assuming it actually bothered to record this time, and hasn't destroyed the SD card yet... And don't even bother trying to pull up recorded videos if you're not on the same Wi-Fi in the same location! At least the new firmware appears to allow us to see who's at the front door remotely, and even talk to him! This is a fantastic idea, poorly executed but getting better. 

Now my big concern is that Samsung is moving to a subscription service. They just added their "cloud" service to the nagware update. If they force that on us, this is an utter waste of money, and to be avoided at all costs. Let's hope they aren't THAT Procrustean.

- The descriptions for some of the setting are not very understandable. I'd love to see some of these issues fixed, however I'm not sure how much effort is being put into updating this app. When I look at prior App updates, I see "Other error fixes". This is incredibly vague. I do not know if the App Developers are addressing any if the functionality issues or not?

title: Much better than other people are saying
text:
After reading many negative reviews, I was a little apprehensive about buying this camera and using this app, but I was pleasantly surprised that it works well for me. 

The setup was super easy without any problems. The camera (SmartCam HD plus) works flawlessly with clear images even at medium resolutions. Even the night vision works well enough to be able to see my large living room in the dark. 

It's true that app could be a little better. The navigation needs a little getting used to, and there seems to be some minor bugs such as not being able to select 720p resolution for recording. It always goes back to default 1080p. 

Some people are complaining loudly that you can not zoom in on a recorded video, only able to zoom live one, but it's not a deal breaker. 

Otherwise, after selecting "auto login" and "remember camera password" options, I don't have to keep logging back in unless I'm switching to different network to access internet. 
Also I haven't had any "time out" problems either although I don't usually stay monitoring more than a few minutes. 

Now they offer cloud storage option for a fee, but after activating Google notifications, I receive event notification email with a picture attachment of the event, and that very much eliminates the need for cloud storage for me since I don't really care to store the video footage in cloud for security purposes. 

Overall, I'm very happy with the camera using this app.

text:

It frequently reports that the private key I'm using was rejected, repeated attempts to connect usually succeed.  On connecting it's pretty slow to load the feed.  When it finally comes up, I've seen it work okay for awhile before just dropping out completely.  I run it in the dark to keep an eye on my daughter, and I also see the IR cutting out pretty regularly for a second or more.  I get no audio through the app either which is part of the reason to have a baby monitor in the first place, no?  

My verdict is that the product is unusable, particularly when employing the iPhone app.   Samsung didn't take the time to get it right, so what might otherwise be a capable little gadget is relegated to paperweight status. I used to be able to do this with the Foscam app that I recently replaced.  

I love the built in lullabies and the ability to record your own voice to play back over the camera.  I wish that you could record more than 30 second clips--perhaps enable the app to save to the microSD card?

title: Unreliable new problem every day.
text:
Something goes wrong every single day with these cameras/this app. Today all 3 of my cameras decided to stop recording events. Tried all the settings and can't get them to record. Ridiculous and why is there Chinese or Japanese on the picture of this app when the cameras as being sold at a huge store like Home Depot in America? 

I mainly bought my camera bc it said "2 megapixel 1080p" sure maybe when absolutely nothing moves in the frame but as soon as something starts moving it looks like a cheap webcam from 10 years ago. App is terrible, barely any features. Will update this review if some miracle happens but will probably have to return my 3 cameras soon bc poor functionality. This app should be ashamed!

One of my cameras decided to not connect to the router frequently and has other issues even though is closer to the router than the other two.

title: What's the point?!
text: What is the point of having the app and camera installed at my house if I can't see what's happening when I'm away from my home?! I read on Costco website reviews (where I purchased the camera from) stating something about not being able to view when you aren't on the same wifi connection--so this is only good for when I'm in the house that I can see what's going on in another room. And then you get a notification of "motion detected" when you're not there and have anxiety b/c you have no idea what's going on. Glad Costco has a good return policy; sad that Samsung can't live up to their product...unless I was just not on the same page with Samsung on what exactly their product and and CAN'T do. A shame.

title: I'm very pleased.
text: I had to return the first camera because I thought it was defective but realized I was setting it up wrong. After installing a new one successful I went and bought a second one because my wife was super pleased with the quality. The app takes a bit getting used to, we had to keep adjusting the settings to get it just right on motion detection and alerts. The only request we would have is to be able to view multiple feeds simultaneously. We have a dedicated iPad set in our kitchen to view the front door feed, switching back to see the backyard feed is not optimal.

title: What's all the fuss?
text: I have an iPhone 6s and the camera and UI works great! I like the many options and features this UI offers for this decent camera at this price. I would give it five stars if I could delete specific recordings of my choosing; rather than having to use overwrite which deletes the oldest recording's first. One other update request, get rid of the constant acknowledgment that I may incur network charges if not using over Wi-Fi. Put a 'Do Not Show Again' check box as requested from other users! Very annoying and the extra two or three second delay may be of concern when in need of prompt review of live or other recordings

title: Good Camera/Bad App
text:
Live video works perfectly from my iPhone 5S whether connected by wifi or 4G.  However, overall in my opinion the app is not user friendly.  

My top 4 gripes with the app:

1.  There should be a toggle on and off button on the main screen to activate the the notices and motion/audio detection when you leave and deactivate when you're home.  Currently, you have to go through several menus to that.

2. I should be able to customize the alert tone so I can distinguish motion detection in my house versus a news alert.

3.  As far as I can tell, you can only automatically record motion/audio events to the SD card and not the app.  You can record to the app manually with 30 second clips.  This does you no good in the camera catches a theft/burglar and records him to the SD card if the theft then steals the camera with the SD card inside.  Motion events should instead be recorded to the app so you have it even if the camera is destroyed or stolen.

4.  The playback clock is horrendous.  It reminds me of something from geometry class.

In sum, it is a great camera by deficient app.

title: Awful
text:
This product is awful. Samsung customer service is totally useless. The app itself works fine but the physical product it syncs with is terrible. 

The biggest problem with the product is after you set up your account on the Samsung SmartCam website, register the camera, get it onto your WiFi network and then set up all your camera preferences and notifications it actually fools you into thinking it works. Then a few hours later, or maybe a day, the camera is gone. It's not on your account, it's not on the app. You now have to go through the process of registering and setting up the camera all over again. This happened three times to me. When I called customer service they said it was defective. I returned to Target, got a new one and the same thing happened.

title: Does not record since February 23 update
text:
Update: since the Feb 23 update, I receive email alerts but even with settings set correctly, it no longer records. Cannot seem to get it to record no matter how much I try. 
Will try a fell reset and see if that works. 

Since about the middle of October, the app has become unreliable in several areas. What had worked with for no longer works anymore. In "settings/events" I cannot disable it anymore. Also suddenly my network ID and password do not match. Spoke to tech support at Samsung but the seemed disinterested in investigating this. According to COSTCO techwin, I am not the only one with these complaints lately. I suspect unintended consequences from a recent app update.

title: Inconsistent
text: The connection to the camera is often slow, although sometimes it is very quick and other times it won't connect at all.  Also I use the same camera in SmartThings and the SmartCam app due to SmartThings being limited in not allowing you to start a manual recording quickly and not having motion detection on the camera, but the issue I had was SmartThings allowed me to use a 11 character password for the camera but the SmartCam app limits that same password to 8 characters so I had to change the password via SmartThings to make it work with both.  The camera itself has remarkable image quality when you can connect though.

title: DO NOT USE AS A BABY MONITOR!!!
text:
How hard is it to make an app that doesn't crash?! It is a crime that you advertise this as a baby monitor when multiple times a night, it will disconnect or freeze. Then, my baby is crying and I CAN'T HEAR OR SEE HER! I have a second monitor I use for sound as a backup. The night vision also goes in and out, so I can't always see her even with the camera up and running. 
Consumers- I read the reviews when my husband bought this camera. I warned him about what others said. I have never written a bad review but I have to tell everyone that the bad reviews are true!! DO NOT USE THIS AS A BABY MONITOR especially at NIGHT. It will freeze or disconnect and your baby could be left crying by herself for hours or worse. 
Samsung- you owe all owners of this device an apology and should be ashamed, or better, SUED!!

title: Should've bought a Nest
text: I read various reviews for a camera. Everything pointed towards their Nest, and I knew there were problems with the app, but this is worse than I expected. I like that the camera doesn't have a monthly cloud storage fee, but I find the quality of the video -- even on highest resolution -- coupled with the awkward app that seems to require a password at every stage and jumps unexpectedly to unintended pages makes this a poor purchase. Luckily Costco has a generous return policy. Samsung can fix this by making a professional app, but they had better act quickly. This current version seems like it was put together by a middle school student for a school project. For an 8th grader I'd,grade the app a C-. For a professional app for something that cost $110, it's a F. Total failure.

title: No Luck with Smartcam setup or with Cosco’s Concierge support
text:
OK no luck here and I’m pretty good with getting technology to work that has poor documentation.
By the way I set up our DropCam in less than 2 minutes a month ago - was hoping for the same experience here but after well over an hour with tech support on the Samsung SmartCam and their not being able to troubleshoot/fix - they gave up.
Issue:  Camera lights and software both don’t match up with what the documentation says should be happening during the setup process.  A) seems the documentation should be accurate, B) Company leadership has got to see they are spending a ton on tech support.  I’ll say the root cause is the documentation.  Best of luck - by the way I’m using a MackBook Pro w/ IOS and a iPhone 6 Plus din;t work on either.

title: Need to and multiple camera viewing
text: Just got these and it's pretty straight forward on the set up. I noticed the delay, however its only about a second and it also depends on your network connection. My biggest request for this app is to add the option to view multiple cameras at the same time. The apps current setup only allows you to switch between cameras to view different areas. Adding the ability to view any number of cameras simultaneously would really add to the appeal of purchasing these cameras. Once they add the multiple cameras view simultaneously to the app I will bump it up to a 5.

title: Overall good; needs a few tweaks
text:
PROS
1. Good quality video day and night

2. Event alerts come on phone.

3. Free service 

4. Easy setup

5. SD Card has option to overwrite when full & only record events

6. You can play messages through speaker, set up a mic, or even talk through your phone.

CONS
1. No cloud based recording (what if thief takes camera)

2. No option to automatically record to your phone up to a specified storage capacity.

3. Sometimes it's very tricky to get accurate event sensitivity; night/day differences, bugs, focused event trigger, etc. Might need different settings for different times of day. 

4. It would be nice for there to be just a snapshot of event as a notification. This would eliminate having to pull video every time to decide if it's legitimate. Also, what if I don't have good internet connection on phone?

In the end I am very pleased with this system. A few thought out tweaks and it could be a very solid system.

title: Prevented burglary!
text:
We originally got SmartCam to watch our dog while we were away at work. However, this app prevented a burglary at our house! My husband got multiple audio/motion notifications on his phone one morning and went into the app to view the video feed - sure enough, 3 idiots broke into the basement and were stealing our stuff Long story short: cops caught all 3 guys, nothing was stolen, and our dog was unharmed (we were able to watch the video feed, and saw that the robbers just ignored him and his tiny barks).
This app is amazing!!!

title: Works just fine!
text: No problems setting up the app. Sure, there are several steps to go through, but prompts were clearly written and easy to follow. I like the no cloud required—not tied into monthly fees. If you need more recording time, replace the 16gb micro card with a 32gb—simple as that. Well-designed app and well-made camera. One improvement I'd like to see is the ability to view more than one camera at a time. Perhaps one can—maybe I just haven't figured that out yet. One more suggestion; an included manual would be helpful rather than having to download it.

title: Enjoy this app
text: I enjoy this app have used it for over a year now , got the camera hooked up to a light switch so I can just turn it on and off as I enter and leave my house, I leave the motion setting on all the time and don't have to mess with turning it on and off doing it this way, the app works good once you learn how to use it , I seen my dog of 14 years stroke out on the app had to put it to sleep later that night .. Great app learn how it works , keep them updates coming, I bought two of the cameras also .

title: Usually OK
text:
The app usually works for me, but there sometimes are slow connection problems with the Samsung server. The cameras I have (E6413BN) have a strange feature. After one month they stop recording video. I can see that there were motion events, but there are no video recordings. Only a hard power off/on reset of the camera will get it to resume recording properly. 

Then, after another month of operation, the recordings again stop until I power cycle them. This happens with all 3 cameras I have. It seems that some timer in the camera gets maxed out. Probably the cameras need a firmware fix.

title: Update stopped iPads from logging in
text:
I have used the app for many months and, aside from occasional loss of connectivity, it has worked fine. I have never had a problem logging in on either an iPad or iPhone. Now the software has been updated to fix a login problem it no longer can access Samsung from an iPad, making the camera useless.

The software, when working, has no ability to scan recorded clips so every one must be run in real time. Trying to locate an event can take hours when the time of an event is not known. Trying to scan the files on a computer is no better as PCs seem to not decode properly. On a Mac they can be watched but there is still no good way to search for events.

title: Not too bad
text:
Camera quality is outstanding. App could use a few improvements:

1. Better way of selecting motion recorded videos, a list of times and durations would be much easier instead of guessing the time on a click wheel.

2. A way for event notices to only trigger iPhone notice for specific cameras and yet still have event recording on. Unfortunately the way it works now I have to turn off iPhone notices entirely otherwise I get a notice for every car that drives by. I do not want to turn on continuous recording to try overcome this programming design flaw.

title: Do not Buy!!!
text: This is terrible, I bought 4 of the new Samsung smart cams because we were looking replace or outdated baby monitors. I am sorry I did. I have been trying for multiple days to register these cameras and all the app told me was server down or can connect to the Internet. I have the newest phones and tablets, also own several att cellular stores.... So I know what I'm doing. I can't believe Samsung would put a product like this out. After messing with these things for 4 days I am taking them back tomorrow. I will be giving my Samsung rep an ear full next time I catch him in 1 of my stores. Save yourself the trouble and don't waste your money on these things. I will be putting in a regular camera system in now and it won't be Samsung.

title: App is Totally Unreliable
text: Most frustrating app ever.  I'm alerted via push notification of detected motion, and when I open the app to check what's going on, it spins "connecting" until it times out and says the camera lost wifi connection.  I get a message that suggests I go through the arduous reconnect process of resetting the camera.  This does not always solve the problem and is very annoying and time consuming.  On the other hand, if I don't do it and try again in 10 minutes, sometimes it will work again.  Nothing is wrong with my wifi and all my other apps and connections work perfectly fine while I'm getting this message.  This happens several times a day/night.

title: Impressed
text: Quick and simple setup of the device and an easy to use app. You may need to port forward 554 & 4520 to get this working on your router. It switches between 5 & 20 fps based on whether you are on 3G or WiFi. The default video was not color (you can change that at the setup page on your browser). The browser pages seem to work better in Firefox rather than Safari on Mac(its Java based and took a while to initally load). Despite this, the app and device are great.

title: Disappointing
text:
Read all of the negative reviews, but I didn't want to pass judgment until I tried it out personally. Disappointment sums it up. 

Like everyone, the idea of viewing your camera on your mobile device was the attention grabber. However, you soon realize that the approach to this was all wrong. If I'm within the network, I should not experience any lag. All of the camera feed is sent to their server, encoded and sent down to the device. I am on a 24mbps down Internet and the quality is subpar. 

I don't write reviews often, but if they are pushing this product as a baby monitor than they deserve the bashing. No way can I justify this lag when my kid's safety is in question.

title: It's pretty good
text:
I've never had a problem viewing camera from my iPhone 5 running iOS6. 
I love that you can hear what's going on and clearly see it to. The night vision works nicely. I'm not sure how to get the speaker to work so that I could communicate with the person that I'm viewing. 
My main complain is that I have to log on to a Computer to adjust speaker sound & other features. It would be great if Samsung would apply those setting features to the iPhone app.  
Other than that, I am pleased with my purchase.

title: Event notifications broken!!!!
text: The field for configuring your email address for event notifications doesn't accept enough characters for the average email address, so you will not be able to setup motion/audio detection unless you setup a special email address just for this device.  Combined with a password complexity requirement that provides no greater security than more reasonable and rational methods, and one has to wonder what kind of person was in charge of this project, and what other sorts of terrible decisions they've made, if you continue further in.  It would not surprise me to find the developers built in back doors to send duplicate copies of all video streams to themselves, or similar idiocy.

title: This thing is great.  Glad I tried it out instead of trusting the negative reviews.
text:
Yesterday in Costco, I read the negative reviews about this app before buying the camera.  I almost put it back on the shelf.  I'm glad I didn't.  

I set it up earlier today and it is amazing.  I've tried every feature and my wife and I love it.  We purchased it to keep an eye on our new dog, but both agree -- it really feels good to have an eye on the home for safety and security.

title: Worst App EVER
text: This is the slowest and worst app I have ever used. It connects to the camera about 5% of the time when I'm at home on the wifi that the camera is on. But if I'm anywhere else no connection. I was able to setup motion detection when I first got the camera, which works fine. Only problem is it is always on, and I receive notifications for every single movement detected. I can't turn off this feature because I can't actually connect to the camera and before I unplugged It I received about 100 notifications in 1 day from the dog walking around. Something needs to be done about this horrible app, but for now I'm done and this is being returned.

title: App needs work
text: Camera is great, quick and easy setup. The app is horrible.  The button that pulls up the menu (event, playback, sd card etc) is inside of the live playback u have to hit the button 20 times to make the menu come up. Each time waiting for the live video before being able to hit the back button. It's just a stupid design and very frustrating. If that were fixed I would be happy with my cam and go buy another for other areas but I'm considering getting something else. I got this for my restaurant and if I can't pull up the playback it's useless.

title: Constant drop connections with additional cameras
text: Added a second Samsung smartcam to the app, however the connection keeps getting dropped. My first camera works just fine. The second camera keeps showing error messages saying there's no internet connection/camera is offline. I've replaced my second camera twice already. The first time I purchased the second camera, it froze during the firmware update then went black. The second time, keeps dropping connection or the camera drops off the app completely. Customer service was not helpful either. Needless to say I'm done giving this camera a chance. Switching brands.

title: Latest version of app is ....
text: I was excited to see a new version of the application especially because I was working around many of the little bugs. But when I notice the the new app no longer lets you control the settings of your cameras, I was really bummed that I had upgraded. The documentation inside the app states that you should be able to control the setup of the camera, but when you touch the icon on the right side of the camera list, it takes you to the camera live feed instead of the setup of the camera. This basically means you can no longer turn on or off the various events from your phone. Ugh.

title: Few fixes away from 5 stars
text:
Cam itself is awesome as many reviews indicate. I agree. See theirs below. 

App is the issue. Not the best. Since people have voiced them enough of its lackluster performance, I'll just add one solution I've realized. 

Non-HD viewing makes everything worse. Video and audio are delayed and sometimes it freezes. Did you notice the "HD" button on the bottom of the screen?  USE IT!!! ALL THE TIME EVERY TIME!!!  HD fixes those delay/freeze issues. Makes me wonder why not just make HD the default setting? Annoying I have to keep remembering to hit that HD button. 

Our Comcast internet is spotty and drops a lot at night when I need to use this cam the most since I use it as a baby monitor as well... So cam gets disconnected whenever network is dropped. Not the app issue, but comcast...  So make sure to have a good internet provider with strong wifi wireless modem.

title: Great camera, terrible app
text: This camera system has so much potential, but the app is a UI nightmare and lacks basic features that should have been included from the start.  For instance... 1. You can't turn the camera off. WTH!  You can't get more basic than that. 2. Since you can't turn the camera off, there's no way to schedule when cameras should turn on or off or via location based awareness. e.g. The camera turns on when you leave (it knows this via your cell phones location) and off when you return. Dropcam has had this basic functionality since 2013.  If Samsung improves this app, this camera could be a Dropcam killer.

title: Ugh. Can you please please please ...
text:
... at least add a shortcut button to "pause" or "suspend" recording and alerts?  It is very annoying to have to go far into the app just to switch OFF motion/audio detection each time I come into my own office and then have to navigate back through the app to turn those functions back ON when I leave the office. 

User interface is pretty much crap. Did the designers do much user experience testing at all??  It's kinda like if a chef were to send his meal out without first tasting it.

title: Really?!? Samsung put their name on this?!?
text:
SAMSUNG TECHWIN, if you want to sell more ip cameras, make a better app! I bought (and like) your HD Smartcam SNH-E6411BN because of it's clear picture and can store video on an SD card without the need for purchasing cloud services. But, come on, this app is so outdated and slow, it's embarrassing. You're 10 years behind Dropcam on functionality, display and features. And since Dropcam only started up 6 years ago, that's saying something. 

Work on: (i) connectivity; (ii) picture displays instead of lists (especially for event files); and (iii) ...... actually, you guys are good at copying other products so just copy Dropcam's app and I'll be happy. Good luck.

title: I read the reviews and almost returned them to Costco
text:
I read the reviews after and almost returned them(2cams bought mid September 2016) to Costco! However I thought I ll give it a shot and see myself, after all it's Costco and will take it back open !

Excellent product and very good app.
(iPhone 6s. Wifi modem Motorola/Comcast )

title: Horrible app
text: Don't waste your time with this app and go return it to Costco.  For example, the password I saved didn't work so I reset password.  It says to log in and change.  Nowhere on the app is "reset password".  I searched on web and it says I have to go to PC web viewer.  I found it on the web but it would not let me log in, just error messages.  Another example; I get messages saying SD card is full and I need to go to SD card setting - it does not tell you where SD card setting is, and I have been searching for ever. Not on the app..... Just a few examples of goofy design I ran into.  It has been two months but I am returning mine....

title: Finally got the update to fix the bug!
text: Have an iPhone 4S and I got this camera about over a month ago at target, had a great price and looked user friendly with great features. I got it and to my dismay although I could view the live camera feed from my computer but something was wrong with the app on my phone. I called tech support which were really nice but unfortunately couldn't do much to help. I've been checking for updates for a while now not wanting to return this camera and... Even with the update it still never loads. I'm so frustrated with this stupid app. If give it no stars if that were an option.

title: When it works
text: When it is working it seems satisfactory. But, frequently it either says that camera not stable or it loads but never finishes loading. I found that the only resolution is to delete the app and re install it. I have gone that four times in last two days since I bought it. The only other thing I would mention is that focal length of the lenses makes it difficult to see details at 30 feet or so. The problem seems to be the app rather than the hardware. Please fix it.

title: Rats!
text: Have purchased 4 of these cameras over the last several months as Costco puts instant rebates on them.  First three worked great.  After installing the 4th, it "hijacked" one of the cameras already installed.  So in the app, in the camera list, when I select the previously installed camera (Camera1), the app displays the view of the newly installed 4th camera, while the 4th camera also displays the same view.  Both cameras are in completely different rooms.  For some reason Camera1 goes offline after installing the 4th camera but the app assigns camera 4's view to camera 1 and camera 4.  Costco is going to get all 4 camera back!

title: I don't know about the other reviews
text:
I love this camera works great 
Does what it supposed to do I would like a better video search that would be nice .. Picture are clear and nice ..for the ppl with bad reviews you might wanna check with you carrier or wifi provider . You don't have to pay for any subscriptions I get notifications in less that 10 seconds up loads in less than 10 seconds .. This app and the camera GIVES ME A PIECE OF MIND ..oh I'm using the Samsung outdoor hd ..

title: Works as advertised! Much better than dropcam
text: Bought Samsung smartcam to avoid paying Google/dropcam subscription fees to record footage for the few times I need to monitor my home. App is free and while not the prettiest it has always functioned as advertised. Can connect and program camera and recording settings from app in addition to live viewing of video and audio from camera. Very satisfied.

title: so useful!
text: great concept, been using it for 10 months... the app needs to be updated and improved a little though... sometimes the app hangs and u dont know, so u have to leave something on in the room to indicate that the video is still live and not frozen... so every now and then i just close the app and reopen just to be sure... and the app needs a "shutter" feature incase YOU want to for privacy reasons. but overall great! and i recommend it!

title: Hands down- the WORST app in the world!
text:
This is such a bad app I don't even know what to say! 

I really don't even know why I'm bothering to waste my time writing about this stupid product either!

FIRST off the "contact us" button for the product homepage tech support DOESN'T work... What kind of company is that???!

The product was really iffy to begin with! 

I kept getting frozen feeds or getting constantly knocked offline or I'd get delayed video, I kept on getting an "unable to connect" message when I knew everything was totally fine!

It's so pathetic but yet I'm holding onto the app in hopes that they actually do something to fix the problems with it!

Total waste of money!!!

title: Good product for the money
text: The camera was easy to setup and works as advertised.  The only thing I wish I could control is the notifications.  You see, I have this camera in an outbuilding and when I go in there to work it alerts me of motion the entire time I'm in there which could be for hours.  I have to unplug it every time and fear that will be the eventual downfall of the device. Simply adding an alert acknowledgment feature with an "ignore alarms" timeframe would make this a perfect device.

title: Update: January 15 update doesn't work
text: After reloading the app, and going through the entire setup again, the app works fine on my iPhone 4S.  Excellent quality video in day time. I bought a second camera to monitor my backyard from inside my house. I also like the wide angle view and the sensitivity of the audio which picks up street sounds like passing cars and neighbor's dogs barking.

title: New firmware is broken
text:
The new firmware for the camera is broken. At 7:00:50, 7:20:50, 7:40:50, 8:00:50, 8:20:50 -etc., the camera will record an audible "tick-tick" noise. Do you see the pattern? All notifications are exactly 20 minutes apart. 

My list of other irritating things that the camera and app do:

1) Records itself and sends me an audio notification every time the camera switches from night to day mode. 

2) Not being able to turn off the  "you may be charged for cellular data" warning when I'm not on wifi. 

3) Inconsistent detection. There are times when my small cats triggered the motion detection, and times where I've stood in front of the camera waving my arms and not triggered the motion alarm. 

4) Viewing in portrait mode makes the image display in upper half of my iPhone 6. In my other iPhone 5 however, it shows the image centered. 

5) Sometimes there is up to a 10 minute delay to receive a motion detection alarm.

title: New app update does not work
text: New app download doesn't work well at all. And after trying to put in all the new passwords, they won't continually stick. I keep having to add the password back for each of the cameras again and again. So when I go to the cameras many times I'll just say that the cameras are off the server for some reason, I have gigabit Internet service through Google and have no issues with anything else and didn't have any issues with this app until this update. I hope Samsung fix it since quickly because I rely on these cameras for a lot of monitoring

title: App review
text: Overall this is a good app. However it will be much easier to review motion sensor clips, if the "previous" and "next" buttons were positioned on the actual clip. Actually, if I want to see the next or previous clip before it ends, I need to go a step back hitting the back button, just to be able to select if I want to see the previous or next clip. After a while, it gets very old and frustrating. Thanks!

title: Needs minor improvements
text:
This app works well for me, I am thoroughly impressed with this camera and app.  
Samsung has provided a really good home recording solution at a good price point. 

The app needs some minor tweaks.  
Every time you open the app while using cellular data it pops up a warning about using data.  It's 2014, if you don't know your cell phone uses data then you shouldn't have one.  Please make that popup something I can tell not to come up again.

When on the app and cellular data the camera stream never seems to get better than VGA.  I can get 720p when on local wifi.  
It would be nice to have the option to choose a lower frame rate but higher quality when remote. This may be difficult for the camera to stream, but would definitely be a nice improvement.

title: Worthless
text: I have used this system for over a year as a monitor for my son's nursery. Sometimes it would have Live Feed issues but they were corrected after (at most) a few days. I haven't been able to leave the Live Feed up on my iPad in WEEKS without it "timing out" after a minute or two. It's worthless to me now. I was hoping this recent "server update" would fix the issue, but no such luck. After reading recent reviews I see I'm not the only one with this issue. Samsung has definitely bumped itself down the list of reliable, quality providers in my book.

title: Works ok
text: For the most part this works fine, burin the middle of the night when I actually need it, it seems to disconnect or the sound just craps out. During the day it's great and picture is quite clear, but at night if there is a reflection or a spot the beam can bounce off of then it causes the camera part to cut in and out. title: Horrible product
